meanings.definition: A confused or chaotic situation; a mess.
meanings.sent1: The picnic turned into a snafu when it started raining unexpectedly.
meanings.sent2: The office move was a complete snafu with boxes misplaced everywhere.
meanings.sent3: The birthday party snafu happened when the cake fell on the floor.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt like a snafu of tangled wires, unable to focus on anything.
meanings.sent5: The snafu at the airport caused many travelers to miss their flights.

meanings.definition: To cause confusion or chaos; to mess up.
meanings.sent1: I managed to snafu the presentation by mixing up the slides.
meanings.sent2: Please don't snafu the schedule by forgetting important appointments.
meanings.sent3: He always finds a way to snafu even the simplest tasks.
meanings.sent4: Her attempt to fix the computer only managed to snafu it further.
meanings.sent5: The chef accidentally snafu'd the recipe by adding too much salt.
